problem.markdown:
1. A transmission line of length more than 160 Km and line voltage higher 100 kV then it is called:
( ) Short Transmission line ( ) Medium Transmission line (x) Long Transmission line ( ) None of these
2. If the overhead transmission line is loaded with the loading equal to the surge impedance, then the voltage at receiving end is:
( ) Greater than the sending end ( ) Less than the sending end (x) Equals to the sending end ( ) None of these
3. The paramters of a transmission line for exact solution are:
(x) Distributed parameters ( ) Lumped parameters ( ) mixed parameters ( ) None of these
4. The value of charging current at the receiving end of the transmission line is:
(x) Zero ( ) Modarate ( ) Equal to load current ( ) None of these
5. The square root of the ratio of line impedance to its shunt admittance is called:
( ) Regulation of the transmission line (x) Surge impedance of the transmission line ( ) Conductance of the transmission line ( ) Surge admittance of the transmission line
6. If the receiving end voltage is greater than the sending end voltage, regulation of transmission line is:
( ) Positive (x) Negative ( ) Zero ( ) None of these
7. The charging current in the transmission line:
( ) lags the voltage by 90˚ ( ) leads the voltage by 45˚ (x) leads the voltage by 90˚ ( ) leads the voltage by 180˚
8. The reflection coefficient of an open-ended transmission line is:
( ) 1.0 ( ) 0.5 (x) -1.0 ( ) 2.0
9. Ferranti effect is experienced on a long overhead transmission lines when it is:
(x) Lightly loaded ( ) fully load at unity pf ( ) fully load at 0.8 p.f. lag ( ) none of the above
10. The power loss in a transmission line due to charging current is:
( ) Ic2R ( ) Ic2R/4 (x) Ic2R/2 ( ) Ic2R/8
problem.p: 1. A transmission line of length more than 160 Km and line voltage higher 100 kV then it is called:
2. If the overhead transmission line is loaded with the loading equal to the surge impedance, then the voltage at receiving end is:

4. The value of charging current at the receiving end of the transmission line is:
5. The square root of the ratio of line impedance to its shunt admittance is called:

choicegroup.choice: Surge impedance of the transmission line
Surge admittance of the transmission line
